en_title: Secretary for Justice visits Islands District (with photos)
zh_title: 律政司司長到訪離島區（附圖）

en: The Secretary for Justice, Ms Teresa Cheng, SC, visited Islands District today (April 1) to see the latest developments in the district. She also met with young people and District Council members during her visit.

Accompanied by the District Officer (Islands), Mr Anthony Li, Ms Cheng visited the Neighbourhood Advice-Action Council Tung Chung Integrated Services Centre. With government funding, the council set up the TOUCH - Support Service Centre for Ethnic Minorities on-site. Cantonese lessons, interest classes and cultural exchange activities are arranged for the ethnic minorities in Tung Chung. In addition, the Centre provides a range of support services and assistance to families and residents in need.
Ms Cheng then proceeded to YMCA of Hong Kong Christian College to meet with students. She chatted with them and listened to their views on studies and extracurricular activities.
Before concluding her visit, Ms Cheng met with Islands District Council members and exchanged views on issues of concern.
zh: 律政司司長鄭若驊資深大律師今日（四月一日）到訪離島區，了解區內最新發展，並與青少年和區議員會面。
在離島區民政事務專員李炳威的陪同下，鄭若驊首先到訪鄰舍輔導會東涌綜合服務中心。鄰舍輔導會獲政府撥款在上址設立TOUCH少數族裔中心，為東涌的少數族裔舉辦粵語班、興趣班及文化交流活動等。中心並為有需要的家庭和人士，提供支援服務和協助。
鄭若驊隨後前往港青基信書院探訪學生，和他們交談，聽取他們對學習和課外活動的想法。
結束訪問前，鄭若驊到訪離島區議會與區議員會面，就雙方關注的事宜交換意見。

She also met with young people and District Council members during her visit.
Accompanied by the District Officer (Islands), Mr Anthony Li, Ms Cheng visited the Neighbourhood Advice-Action Council Tung Chung Integrated Services Centre

Cantonese lessons, interest classes and cultural exchange activities are arranged for the ethnic minorities in Tung Chung
In addition, the Centre provides a range of support services and assistance to families and residents in need.
Ms Cheng then proceeded to YMCA of Hong Kong Christian College to meet with students
She chatted with them and listened to their views on studies and extracurricular activities.
Before concluding her visit, Ms Cheng met with Islands District Council members and exchanged views on issues of concern.
